trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with FreshService | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with FreshService | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use FreshService with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use FreshService with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and FreshService.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and FreshService.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A FreshService single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A FreshService single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to FreshService will be able to single sign into the application using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to FreshService will be able to single sign into the application using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for FreshService
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for FreshService

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for FreshService.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for FreshService.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type FreshService.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type FreshService.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select FreshService, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select FreshService, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Freshservice</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Freshservice</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to FreshService with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to FreshService with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on for FreshService requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on for FreshService requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the FreshService application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the FreshService application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to FreshService page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to FreshService page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the FreshService Sign On URL textbox, type your URL used by your users to sign on to your Freshdesk application (e.g.: "http://democompany.freshservice.com/"), and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the FreshService Sign On URL textbox, type your URL used by your users to sign on to your Freshdesk application (e.g.: "http://democompany.freshservice.com/"), and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at FreshService page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at FreshService page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your FreshService company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your FreshService company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click Admin.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click Admin.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Admin</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Admin</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Customer Portal, click Security.
trans-unit.target: In the Customer Portal, click Security.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Security</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Security</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Security section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Security section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Sign On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Sign On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Switch Single Sign OnON.
trans-unit.target: Switch Single Sign OnON.

trans-unit.source: Select SAML SSO.
trans-unit.target: Select SAML SSO.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at FreshService dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the SAML Login URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at FreshService dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the SAML Login URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at FreshService dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Logout URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at FreshService dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Logout URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: Copy the Thumbprint value from the exported certificate, and then paste it into the Security Certificate Fingerprint textbox.
trans-unit.target: Copy the Thumbprint value from the exported certificate, and then paste it into the Security Certificate Fingerprint textbox.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into FreshService, they must be provisioned into FreshService.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into FreshService, they must be provisioned into FreshService.

trans-unit.source: In the case of FreshService, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of FreshService, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your FreshService company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your FreshService company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click Admin.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click Admin.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Admin</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Admin</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the User Management section, click Requesters.
trans-unit.target: In the User Management section, click Requesters.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Requesters</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Requesters</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click New Requester.
trans-unit.target: Click New Requester.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New Requesters</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New Requesters</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the New Requester section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the New Requester section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New Requester</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New Requester</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter the First Name and Email attributes of a valid Azure Active Directory account you want to provision into the related textboxes.
trans-unit.target: Enter the First Name and Email attributes of a valid Azure Active Directory account you want to provision into the related textboxes.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Active Directory account holder will get an email including a link to confirm the account before it becomes active
trans-unit.target: The Azure Active Directory account holder will get an email including a link to confirm the account before it becomes active

trans-unit.source: You can use any other FreshService user account creation tools or APIs provided by FreshService to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other FreshService user account creation tools or APIs provided by FreshService to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the FreshService **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the FreshService **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
